Docs.param: The desired resource identifier, as generated by the aapt tool. This integer encodes the package, type, and resource entry. The value 0 is an invalid identifier.

the desired screen density indicated by the resource as found in DisplayMetrics. A value of 0 means to use the density returned from #getConfiguration(). This is equivalent to calling #getDrawable(int).
Docs.summary: Return a drawable object associated with a particular resource ID for the given screen density in DPI.
Docs.returns: Drawable An object that can be used to draw this resource.

Docs.param: The desired resource identifier, as generated by the aapt tool. This integer encodes the package, type, and resource entry. The value 0 is an invalid identifier.
The base value of this fraction. In other words, a standard fraction is multiplied by this value.
The parent base value of this fraction. In other words, a parent fraction (nn%p) is multiplied by this value.
Docs.summary: Retrieve a fractional unit for a particular resource ID.
Docs.returns: Attribute fractional value multiplied by the appropriate base value.

Docs.param: The name of the desired resource.
Optional default resource type to find, if "type/" is not included in the name. Can be null to require an explicit type.
Optional default package to find, if "package:" is not included in the name. Can be null to require an explicit package.
Docs.summary: Return a resource identifier for the given resource name.
Docs.returns: int The associated resource identifier. Returns 0 if no such resource was found. (0 is not a valid resource ID.)

Docs.summary: Open a file descriptor for reading a raw resource.
Docs.returns: AssetFileDescriptor A new file descriptor you can use to read the resource. This includes the file descriptor itself, as well as the offset and length of data where the resource appears in the file. A null is returned if the file exists but is compressed.
